articles.headline: Geraldine Largay’s Wrong Turn: Death on the Appalachian Trail
articles.snippet: “When you find my body, please call my husband George and my daughter Kerry,” Ms. Largay, 66, wrote in her diary after she became lost while hiking in Maine.
articles.abstract: “When you find my body, please call my husband George and my daughter Kerry,” Ms. Largay, 66, wrote in her diary after she became lost while hiking in Maine.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Me. — She was afraid of being alone and prone to anxiety, a diminutive 66-year-old woman with a poor sense of direction, hiking the Appalachian Trail by herself, who wandered into terrain so wild, it is used for military training. She waited nearly a month in the Maine woods for help that never came.
articles.byline: By Jess Bidgood and Richard Pérez-Peña

articles.headline: Nick Denton, Gawker Founder, Assails Peter Thiel as ‘Vindictive’ Foe
articles.snippet: Gawker Media also hired an investment banker to help explore its options for a possible sale.
articles.abstract: Gawker Media also hired an investment banker to help explore its options for a possible sale.
articles.lead_paragraph: A day after Peter Thiel explained why he had given about $10 million to fund multiple lawsuits against Gawker Media, the site’s founder published an open letter to the Silicon Valley billionaire, calling him “thin-skinned” and a “comic book villain” and challenging him to a public debate about the role of journalism in society.
articles.byline: By Katie Rogers and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Disney v. Warner: How Captain America Beat Batman and Superman
articles.snippet: Warner Bros.’ “Batman v Superman” would seem to have the box-office edge, but “Captain America: Civil War” has surged past it.
articles.abstract: Warner Bros.’ “Batman v Superman” would seem to have the box-office edge, but “Captain America: Civil War” has surged past it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pitched battles between superheroes with huge fan bases? Check.

articles.headline: Google Prevails as Jury Rebuffs Oracle in Code Copyright Case
articles.snippet: The decision, which will be appealed, means that Google owes its Silicon Valley rival nothing for code it used in the Android operating system.
articles.abstract: The decision, which will be appealed, means that Google owes its Silicon Valley rival nothing for code it used in the Android operating system.
articles.lead_paragraph: A jury ruled in favor of Google on Thursday in a long legal dispute with Oracle over software used to power most of the world’s smartphones.
articles.byline: By Nick Wingfield and Quentin Hardy

articles.headline: North Korea Linked to Digital Attacks on Global Banks
articles.snippet: Security researchers say this is the first known case of a nation using malicious code to steal money for pure financial profit.
articles.abstract: Security researchers say this is the first known case of a nation using malicious code to steal money for pure financial profit.
articles.lead_paragraph: Security researchers have tied the recent spate of digital breaches on Asian banks to North Korea, in what they say appears to be the first known case of a nation using digital attacks for financial gain.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and Michael Corkery

articles.headline: At Hiroshima Memorial, Obama Says Nuclear Arms Require ‘Moral Revolution’
articles.snippet: “Technological progress without an equivalent progress in human institutions can doom us,” said Mr. Obama, the first sitting American president to visit the city.
articles.abstract: “Technological progress without an equivalent progress in human institutions can doom us,” said Mr. Obama, the first sitting American president to visit the city.
articles.lead_paragraph: HIROSHIMA, Japan — President Obama laid a wreath at the Hiroshima Peace Memorial on Friday, telling an audience that included survivors of America’s atomic bombing in 1945 that technology as devastating as nuclear arms demands a “moral revolution.”

articles.headline: Finally, Private Unemployment Insurance. But Will Anyone Buy It?
articles.snippet: IncomeAssure offers coverage that provides half your pretax pay, minus state jobless benefits, for up to 24 weeks.
articles.abstract: IncomeAssure offers coverage that provides half your pretax pay, minus state jobless benefits, for up to 24 weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Obama wants more of us to have insurance that would make up the difference between a job we might lose and any new, lower-paying one we might take. He said so in his State of the Union address in January.

articles.headline: Where More Women Are on Boards, Executive Pay Is Higher
articles.snippet: An analysis by Equilar last year found that among 100 large companies, those with greater gender diversity on their boards paid their chief executives about 15 percent more.
articles.abstract: An analysis by Equilar last year found that among 100 large companies, those with greater gender diversity on their boards paid their chief executives about 15 percent more.
articles.lead_paragraph: Appointing more women to corporate boards has long been viewed as a good thing for a company’s performance and for society as a whole.

articles.headline: Top C.E.O. Pay Fell — Yes, Fell — in 2015
articles.snippet: While the top-paid chief executives at the nation’s largest companies received an average of $19 million last year, that figure was down from 2014.
articles.abstract: While the top-paid chief executives at the nation’s largest companies received an average of $19 million last year, that figure was down from 2014.
